This man bores me to tears. I don't know if it's overuse of the word "dramatic" (up next, we have some dramatic new footage of a dramatic development in this dramatic story, stay tuned!), the fact that he's nearly monotone, or what, but he comes off as drier than Ben Stein to me.
 
 Anyone else find him old and tired?
 
 EDIT: Doh, I misread the description--here I thought this forum was to talk about the news. Feel free to move this to whereever it may be relevant. 
 
 In the meantime, discuss! :p

Who's Wolf Blitzer?

 
 haha, he works for CNN.

haha, he works for CNN.

 Who's CNN? :)
Haha! No kidding, CNN's really going down the tubes. Talent seems to be bailing ship left and right. First Bill Hemmer, now Aaron Brown gone. They're not going to have anyone left!

CNN is garbage...they are trying to act like Fox News now and failing.

 
 Saw this article and it made me think of your comments. 
 
 http://www.marketwatch.com/news/story.asp?guid=%7B75507B19-E941-4C70-8AAB-66BAD41395D0%7D&siteid=google
 
 Basically, Dick Parsons, Time Warner Chairman spoke at an event and had to field some questions on Fox News:
 
 
But interestingly, Parsons didn't say a word about what may well be Time Warner's most prominent global subsidiary, CNN -- until the very last query. When a media reporter asked about Fox's "dominance," Parsons probably wished that he was stomping grapes in Italy instead of fielding questions.
 
 But company-man that he is, Parsons managed to issue what sounded (to me) like an emphatically lukewarm review. "'Dominance' is a strong word," Parsons began cautiously, measuring his words like the corporate lawyer he used to be.
 
 Parsons then said he "can foresee" a day when CNN takes back the ratings lead from Fox -- but tactfully declined to specify in what year (or decade -- or century) that might occur.

 
 More of the same from the CNN heads...FNC is dominating them, we know it, Fox knows it, and CNN knows it.
Wolf Blitzer doesn't bore me at all. I NEVER WATCH HIM!!! He's a dupe for the socialist/liberal destroy-the-present-form-of-government campaign and has been off my list of speakers for quite a while.

Wolf Blitzer doesn't bore me at all. I NEVER WATCH HIM!!! He's a dupe for the socialist/liberal destroy-the-present-form-of-government campaign and has been off my list of speakers for quite a while.

 
 It's refreshing to hear I'm not the only one who thinks CNN and it's reporters tend to be slanted.

It's refreshing to hear I'm not the only one who thinks CNN and it's reporters tend to be slanted.
Almost all reporters are slanted. The only way to get news today without the additional slant of the station or the reporter is to subscribe to UPI or AP and get it directly from them. That's where most of the news you read in the papers comes from. Even they will be slanted a bit because there's always human involvement in making up the text. BBC has been known to have a liberal slant now and then, too. Jim Lehrer is close to untainted but...like I said, there's a slant to everything produced by "journalists". The best and most truthful news facts usually come from the nitwits that get interviewed at the scene on TV, or from the police reports, written and verbal.

MSNBC has started to act more like Fox News because they see that extreme left TV is not working so well anymore. The "right" now controls the radio and TV....haha only the internet to go.
 
 MSNBC has bowtie man and Scarbough (no one in their right mind can spell his name) both of which seem to lean more conservative or libertarian
Well, everyone's mimicking Fox. It's the "if you can't beat em, join em" strategy. They can't come near them in the ratings, so they're trying to be like them to see if that helps.
